Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Sufentanil Sublingual Tablet System for Postoperative Pain Management

Participants.evidence: Eligible participants were adults undergoing open abdominal surgery.

Intervention.evidence: Patients were randomised 2:1 to receive SSTS 15 μg or placebo

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the efficacy and safety of a sufentanil sublingual tablet system (SSTS) for managing postoperative pain following open abdominal surgery.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the time-weighted summed pain intensity difference (SPID) over 48 hours.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: randomisation and allocation concealment via an interactive web-response system

Blinding.evidence: Blinding included patients, investigators, and study personnel.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A sample size of 180 was planned, with 172 randomised (115 to SSTS, 57 to placebo).

Result_Outcome.evidence: The SPID48 was significantly higher in the SSTS group than in the placebo group (least squares mean [SEM], 105.60 [10.14] vs 55.58 [13.11]; P = 0.001).

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were similar between groups, with no severe events in the SSTS group.
